metadata: This file defines types for the Next.js pages with primary layout and the app props with layout. It includes the definitions for `PageWithPrimaryLayout` and `AppPropsWithLayout`.
This file defines the types used in Redux for user data. It includes an interface `IUser` with properties `uid` of type string and `email` of type string.

This file defines the Redux store configuration for the HyperNext project. It imports necessary functions from '@reduxjs/toolkit' and the userReducer from './slices/userSlice'. It combines the reducers, sets up the store, and exports types for the store and root state. The 'store' constant is also exported along with the 'ReduxState' type.

This file is userSlice.ts located in the ../HyperNext/src/app/redux/slices/ directory. It contains the Redux slice for managing user data. The slice includes actions to set user data (uid, email), set user email, set user uid, and clear user data. The initial state consists of an empty user object with uid and email fields.

File: meta.ts
Description: This file contains constants for the HyperNext project, including the product name, tagline, description, and copyright information.

This file contains global CSS styles for the project. It defines CSS variables for foreground and background colors based on light and dark color schemes. It also includes styles for a gradient background and basic body styling.

This file is Container.tsx located in ../HyperNext/src/components/. It contains a functional component called Container that takes children and className as props. The component renders a div with the class 'container mx-auto' along with any additional className provided, and renders the children inside the div.

This file, IconWrapper.tsx, contains a React functional component called IconWrapper. It takes in a prop called icon, which is a ReactElement. The component clones the icon element and adds a className of IconWrapperClass to it before rendering it.

This file is SectionTitle.tsx located at ../HyperNext/src/components/SectionTitle.tsx. It defines a functional component called SectionTitle that takes in props align, pretitle, title, and children. The component renders a section title with optional pretitle, title, and children content within a Container component. The align prop determines the alignment of the section title.

This file is ThemeSwitch.tsx located in ../HyperNext/src/components/. It contains a React component that allows users to switch between light and dark themes using next-themes. The component renders icons for light and dark modes and saves the selected theme in local storage.

This file, Intro.tsx, located at ../HyperNext/src/components/Landing/Intro.tsx, contains the introductory section of the Next.js Template. It includes the rendering of the project name, a brief description, a link to view the project on Github, an image component, social proofs from companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Netflix, Sony, and Verizon, and information about the project's trustworthiness with 2000+ customers worldwide. The file also renders company logos based on the social proofs provided.

This file is BenefitBullet.tsx located at ../HyperNext/src/components/Landing/BenefitBullet.tsx. It defines a React component called BenefitBullet that takes in props for an icon, title, and children. The component renders a styled bullet point with the provided icon, title, and content.

This file, Benefits.tsx, is located at ../HyperNext/src/components/Landing/Benefits.tsx. It contains a React functional component called Benefits, which takes in props imgPos and data of type TBenefits. The component renders a section displaying benefits with images, titles, descriptions, and bullet points.

This file (ReduxSetExample.tsx) is located at ../HyperNext/src/components/Examples/ReduxSetExample.tsx. It contains a functional component named ReduxSetExample that utilizes React hooks. The component dispatches the setUserUid action from the userSlice Redux slice using the useDispatch hook. The setUserUid action is dispatched with a specific user ID ('e2d6c15f-6eae-57ed-8122-a801d3d4fd5c') when the component mounts.

This file is ReactQueryExample.tsx located at ../HyperNext/src/components/Examples/ReactQueryExample.tsx. It contains a React functional component that utilizes the useGithubUser hook to fetch GitHub user data and displays the user's name and bio.

This file is ReduxFetchExample.tsx located at ../HyperNext/src/components/Examples/ReduxFetchExample.tsx. It contains a React functional component that demonstrates fetching data from Redux store using useSelector hook and useEffect hook for side effects.

This file is Navbar.tsx located at ../HyperNext/src/layouts/Navbar.tsx. It contains the navigation bar component for the project, including links to different sections like Product, Features, Pricing, Company, and Blog. The component also includes a theme switcher and a responsive menu toggle for smaller screens.

This file is PrimaryLayout.tsx located at ../HyperNext/src/layouts/PrimaryLayout.tsx. It contains a React functional component named PrimaryLayout, which serves as the primary layout for the project. The component includes a Navbar, a Container component, and a Footer. It also handles page metadata such as title and description using Head from next/head.

This file, Footer.tsx, contains the React component for the footer of the website. It includes the navigation items, legal items, and social links. The footer displays the product name, description, and links to other pages. It also includes links to legal pages and social media platforms like Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn. The footer component is designed to be responsive and visually appealing, with proper spacing and styling for different screen sizes.
This file is located at ../HyperNext/src/api/github.api.ts and it contains functions to fetch a GitHub user's data and a custom hook to use the fetched data.

File: benefits.tsx

Description: This file defines the data structure for benefits in the HyperNext project. It includes types for benefits, bullets, and icons. It also initializes primary and secondary benefits with titles, descriptions, images, and corresponding bullet points with icons. The primary benefits focus on utilities like Redux, React Query, and React Portals, while the secondary benefits highlight features such as mobile responsiveness, Next.js & TailwindCSS integration, and light & dark mode support.

This file is the index.tsx file located at ../HyperNext/src/pages/. It imports various components such as Benefits, Intro, SectionTitle, and PrimaryLayout. It also imports constants like PRODUCT_DESCRIPTION and data like PrimaryBenefits and SecondaryBenefits. The file defines a Home component that includes an Intro section and a Benefits section displaying PrimaryBenefits and SecondaryBenefits. The Home component is wrapped in a PrimaryLayout.

This file is located at ../HyperNext/src/pages/_document.tsx and it contains the custom document structure for the Next.js project. It imports Html, Head, Main, and NextScript from 'next/document' and defines the Document component which renders the basic HTML structure with the main content and next scripts.

This file is the `_app.tsx` file located in the `src/pages` directory of the HyperNext project. It contains the main component for customizing the Next.js App component. The file imports the Redux store, global styles, page types, theme provider, Redux provider, and React Query components. The `App` component receives `Component` and `pageProps` as props, sets up a layout, creates a React Query client, and wraps the app with providers for Redux and React Query.

This file is an API route in a Next.js project located at ../HyperNext/src/pages/api/hello.ts. It defines a handler function that responds with a JSON object containing the name 'John Doe' when the route is accessed.
